body: @michaelandrepearce I'm not sure I follow you. Here, we fixed in `activemq-jms-pool`, you mean to "reuse" artemis connection pool ?
Ah, I guess you mean that `jms-pool` should be in a shared repository to be used by activemq and artemis, right ?
Yup exactly, extract the module into its own repo.
As reminder, leveldb will be completely removed.
Not for 5.16 though?
That's my intention, I will send an update on the mailing list.
OK fine with me. Could it be applied to 5.15.x then?
Yes definitely.
Waiting Jenkins end before merging.
@michaelandrepearce you are right: if it's used in both ActiveMQ and Artemis, it makes sense to share it. The question is where ? Do we have to create a new `activemq-share` repo ?
The webconsole issue on Karaf is not related to jetty upgrade. See #486
Let me take a look if it's worth to merge.
Require fix from #510
closing for now as we need to drop Scala and LevelDB

> `<ant-version/>` should be removed from the main parent pom.
> 
> And I think this dependency is required as the openwire-generator is used in activemq-client for the `openwire-generate` profile. I think it's require for the provided task. Let me check.

Hello @jbonofre, could you please confirm again if `<ant-version>` should be removed? I just removed an unwanted deprecated dependency.

Please let me know.

Thanks
Sourabh
I also have a branch with full build on JDK 11+, I will open and will let you know.
@jbonofre requesting for an update.
I'm testing the branch locally.
It has been fixed already by another contributor.
I guess it's fixed with AMQ-5790, right ?
I think the overflow issue is really rare. However, worth to merge it, just to prevent.
Thanks!
Weird, it seems to pass on my machine.
I'm doing a full build on my machine to be sure.

I'm able to reproduce the failure:
186 [ERROR] Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 1.19 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.activemq.blob.DownloadStrategyTest
187 [ERROR] testFTPBlobDownloadStrategy(org.apache.activemq.blob.DownloadStrategyTest)  Time elapsed: 0.08 s  <<< ERROR!

OK, I confirm that `master` works but not `pr-517`.
@jbonofre I just pushed a fix.
This was pushed in another commit
@jmesnil This issue still causes some problems and it seems it has not been fixed in master. Is there a possibility to merge it?
@tadamski I'm not a committer for https://github.com/apache/activemq. You'll have to ping someone that can merge this PR.
@jmesnil ahh, OK, thanks for info
@cshannon would it be possible to merge this PR?
@tadamski - seems fine to me, I will create a JIRA and merge it
Great, thanks!

The issue here seems to be that the selector Set itself is synchronized but the lock is not used when iterating. 

https://github.com/apache/activemq/blob/activemq-5.16.0/activemq-broker/src/main/java/org/apache/activemq/plugin/SubQueueSelectorCacheBroker.java#L150

The other method called getSelectorsForDestination() appears to copy into a new HashSet but that method also isn't safe either as it doesn't lock while creating the new HashSet (it will iterate and copy into the new set before returning)
Also, all the contains key stuff appears to not be threadsafe either. Multiple methods are checking if key exists and then getting but not checking for null.
I will merge this in and then fix the rest of it.
@cshannon agreed, good catch! I was eyes on the caller and the dupe method that was returning a ref to the internal collection values.
You should rebase. your branch correctly. if this is to be merged it would create a mess with a big/ huge merge commit.

Hello @jbonofre. I confirmed the profile build of `openwire-generate` as instructed here in https://github.com/apache/activemq/blob/master/activemq-client/pom.xml#L301.

The old Ant dependency does not seem to be associated to any underlying modules as far as I could see.

Hence, it can be safely removed from `activemq-openwire-generator`

> <ant-version/>

`<ant-version/>` holds the version for the latest Ant groupid. Could you please calrify again?
The PR doesn't seem base on the right `master` branch. Can you please rebase ?
Closing this as it was since fixed by: https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/4450c17c1c836a1daa7541dcb944f35798258197
I'm working on Spring 5 update directly for 5.17. For 5.16 and 5.15, I will update directly.

The problem with removing the ant dependency, is that ant still comes in via the gram dependency. This module has not been used in a long, long time by the looks of it - @jbonofre maybe we could just remove it for 5.17.0?
@jbonofre There is a new CVE out fixed in 9.4.33 - https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-27216
I'm on it ;)
Can someone from the community please check this request ?

This is not necessary and is not going to work as there are many subtypes in those messages that are not serializable. You can use OpenWireFormat to marshall/unmarshall the data into bytes and persist it to a database.  See https://github.com/apache/activemq/blob/master/activemq-client/src/main/java/org/apache/activemq/openwire/OpenWireFormat.java

Also, in the future a Jira needs to be created and tests need to be added.
Jira ticket?
There's no: it's pure infra to use the new apache ci with multi branch pipeline.
I just sent a message on the mailing list.
I have some refactoring in progress on `master` impacting this class (and others).
Any update about my comment related to AMQ-5790 ?
Can you please rebase ?
Please open PR based only on `master`. Thanks.
Can you please rebase and fix the conflicts ?
Can you please rebase ?
Awesome ! Thanks ! Let me take a look.

it seems to me that you sent the PR to a wrong branch.

Please do the PR again.. I would start over by branching the right branch.. and then cherry-picking the commit you intended to send.

> Any update about my comment related to AMQ-5790 ?

Ah, sorry for not answering at all.
As a matter of fact we did not yet check the fix because we were successfully using a patched version built in-house and we did not migrate to a newer version of the RA. But we did migrate to EAP7 in the meantime, so the whole setup changed. As far as I know with the current setup and the current EAP7 resource adapter the behavior we witnessed in March don't occur anymore.
@nevezhyn thanks ! For the record, can you please include Jira ID in the commit comment next time ? Thanks again !
The test failures on Jenkins doesn't seem related to the PR. Let me double check.
LGTM, the Jenkins failure is not related to your change. Thanks !
I get removal of leveldb not sure why removal of broker partitioning has been lumped in at the same time
@michaelandrepearce both are "related", as activemq-partition uses activemq-leveldb zookeeper client. Do you think it makes sense to keep partition ?

Very much so. Partition is something given time something id like to port to artemis, its something when doing so would make it more an api so its not coupled as tightly with zk (e.g. zk just would be a pluggable option) but it certainly is very nice feature that helps broker setup be scaleable without manually having to shard/partition flows manually as a user. 

Probably worth if you want to remove deps on leveldb to switch the client to just zk.
@michaelandrepearce ok thanks. I'm refactoring activemq-partition to avoid the dependency to leveldb and I will let there.
Can you please squash the commits in one ? Thanks !
@coheigea mind to take a look ?
@coheigea I updated the PR, if you mind to do a new pass. Thanks !
Thanks ! I will merge it ASAP !

Do we normally cherry-pick these back to other branches? I can do that as well.

Given the conversation on version support it seems reasonable to put to 5.16.x

Agree with Claus, this shouldn't be merged without a better understanding of the root cause. I'm not following how this would fix the problem. Perhaps in Glassfish an undesirable class is being loaded first via the TCCL? Or perhaps a service locator issue, or a mis-match of ActiveMQ jar versions.

The current code falls back to the class's classloader if the TCCL does not find the class.

Sorry @jbonofre - I created the change before I found AMQ-8167, so you might've already done this and this is just duplicate work. However I figured it's good to kick off a build and at least see if there's any issues in the full suite!

@ehossack-aws for the record, please, include the Jira ID in the commit message. For instance, something like "[AMQ-8167] Upgrade to Jetty 9.4.39.v20210224". It allows the link between Jira and PR.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-8167
FYI: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-8159

> @ehossack-aws for the record, please, include the Jira ID in the commit message. For instance, something like "[AMQ-8167] Upgrade to Jetty 9.4.39.v20210224". It allows the link between Jira and PR.
> 
> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-8167

Will do next time!

edit: and this time, once I rebase around the skipped tests 😅

Looks like there is a reason for serviceRead() to be in the doInit(). Looks like it was specifically added for the auto+nio+ssl use case and when used for bridges.  Start/Stop

ref: https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/ed0e786b6002633411037923fb28a075489e442b
submit to wrong branch.. closing
There might be a better way than what I did but if I recall auto+nio+ssl was having issues without this change. It's been a long time since i looked at it though
Thanks, I'm testing on my machine as well.
I guess the same should be applied to AMQ SSL test, I will tackle this if required.

FYI, when I do:

```
mvn clean test -Dtest=Stomp11NIOSSLTest
```

it works.

I do the same again:

```
[ERROR] Failures: 
[ERROR]   Stomp11NIOSSLTest>Stomp11Test.testDurableSubAndUnSubOnTwoTopics:939
[INFO]
[ERROR] Tests run: 31, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
```

It's what I meant when the test is flaky.
I'm testing on the PR now.

The main thing I was looking at was StompNIOSSLTest#testDisconnectDoesNotDeadlockBroker was breaking in CI and also locally for me and this PR fixed that at least. That other test you reference has always been flaky even before I was working on the auto transport stuff years ago.
OK, so it's what I thought: it's not the same thing, and the build randomly fail (including on Jenkins). I will do a new test on those tests, eventually excluding them (or isolating in a profile).

I ran `activemq-stomp` build several times without failure. So, it seems your change improves the overall situation. I'm doing a set of new run and I will merge.

Thanks !

Thanks for checking that.  The change seems like it should prevent any more of those errors by preventing concurrent access to the SSL engine. Also generally there won't be any contention after init so there should be very minimal overhead with uncontended locking so I wouldn't expect any noticeable performance hit.
What's the change in this PR ? Just cleaning the indentation ?
Rebasing and keeping partition.
@michaelandrepearce I have updated the PR to keep `activemq-partition` and remove `activemq-leveldb`.
At least the Stomp NIO SSL test is more stable now. Let me merge this one and I will move forward on other flaky tests.
I'm fixing the compilation issue due to rebase. I will update the PR soon.
Hey @mattrpav . I guess the purpose is for security reason: to "hide" the Jetty server version for clients (and so avoid potential use of Jetty version header for a known attack). Correct ?
OK I saw the discussion in the Jira, it makes sense. I don't think we need to do it configurable for the transport connector. I will test the PR rebased on `master` as I fixed the tests ;)
No answer from author, and it seems to be just an indentation change.
Superseeded by https://github.com/apache/activemq/pull/630
Hey JB-  curious as to why remove this?  The CMS and NMS sub-projects still active. Is there an alternate module for generating the openwire classes and structures for non-Java
@mattrpav my bad, this PR was not expected (local test). Nevermind.
